## Analysing Math Anxiety Data

#### Accessing Math Anxiety Dataset from PC



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
math_anxiety <- read_delim(file = "../../data/MathAnxiety.csv", delim = ";")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 599 Columns: 6
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ";"
chr (2): Gender, Grade
dbl (3): AMAS, RCMAS, Arith
num (1): Age

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
math_anxiety
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 599 × 6
     Age Gender Grade      AMAS RCMAS Arith
   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
 1  1378 Boy    Secondary     9    20     6
 2  1407 Boy    Secondary    18     8     6
 3  1379 Girl   Secondary    23    26     5
 4  1428 Girl   Secondary    19    18     7
 5  1356 Boy    Secondary    23    20     1
 6  1350 Girl   Secondary    27    33     1
 7  1336 Boy    Secondary    22    23     4
 8  1393 Boy    Secondary    17    11     7
 9  1317 Girl   Secondary    28    32     2
10  1348 Boy    Secondary    20    30     6
# ℹ 589 more rows
```


:::
:::



#### Average of Grades Both Genders in Primary and Secondary



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
math_anxiety %>% 
  group_by(Gender, Grade) %>%
  summarize(average_Arith = mean(Arith), average_AMAS = mean(AMAS), average_RCMAS = mean(RCMAS))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Gender'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 4 × 5
# Groups:   Gender [2]
  Gender Grade     average_Arith average_AMAS average_RCMAS
  <chr>  <chr>             <dbl>        <dbl>         <dbl>
1 Boy    Primary            5.87         20.9          18.6
2 Boy    Secondary          4.31         21.5          17.4
3 Girl   Primary            5.74         22.7          20.6
4 Girl   Secondary          4.24         23.5          20.3
```


:::
:::
